title: How many years are there between BC and AD? - Quora

response.answer_text: AD stands for Anno Domini, Latin for “in the year of the Lord”, while BC stands for “before Christ”. However since it was realised that much of the globe is not christian, the terms were adapted to Before Common Era or Before Current Era or Before Christian Era: used when referring to any year before the birth of Christ, when the christian calendar starts.
There aren’t any in-between. The way the calendar is designed, the last day of 1 BC was followed by the first day of 1 AD. So there isn’t even a split second between the two.
